intro: Thespesia robusta, commonly known as the Tahitian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Ocean. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, featuring thick, waxy leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Thespesia robusta is adapted to coastal and saline environments, making it a hardy species in tropical climates. Its botanical characteristics make it an important plant in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
